body: Note that this is found in Spark.
Interesting.... never saw this :( will have a look

@zsxwing @rxin if you find anything else in the meantime that you can share which may help please let me know. Would it also be possible to get the heap-dump itself or does it contain sensitive data ?

@zsxwing @rxin I tried to reproduce it via a test-case but so far no luck :( 

One question do you often create new threads which will die later ?

@normanmaurer Thanks for taking a look. Sorry that I'm not allowed to share the heap-dump as it's a production job.

We don't call NioEventLoop directly. Here are the codes creating the EventLoopGroup: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/v2.1.0-rc5/common/network-common/src/main/java/org/apache/spark/network/client/TransportClientFactory.java#L104
and the codes set up the client: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/v2.1.0-rc5/common/network-common/src/main/java/org/apache/spark/network/client/TransportClientFactory.java#L200

One notable thing is we use the same EventLoopGroup for multiple clients.
@zsxwing but do you ofthen create new "TransportClientFactory" instances and destroy them ?
@normanmaurer We create several `TransportClientFactory`s for different modules but never destroy them until stopping the whole application.

And you you allocate buffers only from within EventLoop threads or also from outside ?

> On 22 Dec 2016, at 19:36, Shixiong Zhu <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> @normanmaurer <https://github.com/normanmaurer> We create several TransportClientFactorys for different modules but never destroy them until stopping the whole application.
> 
> â€”
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/6153#issuecomment-268862276>, or mute the thread <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAa0QuCHNmfziLXkLVW2UqZAJqumXYXVks5rKsNKgaJpZM4LTjWL>.
>

> And you you allocate buffers only from within EventLoop threads or also from outside ?

Only within EventLoop thread. We also use Unpooled to allocate buffers outside. By the way, is it safe to release a ByteBuf outside the EventLoop thread? This may happen in our codes.
Yes it is allowed... may these threads die frequently?

> Yes it is allowed... may these threads die frequently?

I don't think so, unless Netty kills them internally.
Saw this issue again today. Since I only saw this after Spark upgraded Netty from 4.0.41.Final to 4.0.42.Final, it's likely because of some change between these two versions. Hope this is helpful.
